Sequence Information.Source: Litoria splendida (Magnificent tree frog) (Emerald spotted tree frog)
Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the frog skin active peptide family (Caerin subfamily)
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: [Ref.15203252]No  cytotoxicity information found[Ref.19642086]No  cytotoxicity information found
Sequence Information.Function: Antibacterial peptide, that adopts an alpha helical conformation which can disrupt bacterial membranes. Each caerin displays a different antimicrobial specificity.
Sequence Information.Tissue specificity: Expressed by the skin parotoid and/or rostral glands.

Literature.Title: Host-defence peptides of Australian anurans structure, mechanism of action and evolutionary significance.
Literature.Author: Apponyi MA, Pukala TL, Brinkworth CS, Maselli VM, Bowie JH, Tyler MJ, Booker GW, Wallace JC, Carver JA, Separovic F, Doyle J, Llewellyn LE.

Literature.Title: The host-defence skin peptide profiles of Peron's Tree Frog Litoria peronii in winter and summer. Sequence determination by electrospray mass spectrometry and activities of the peptides.
Literature.Author: Bilusich D, Jackway RJ, Musgrave IF, Tyler MJ, Bowie JH.

Literature.Title: Peptides from Australian frogs. Structures of the caerins and caeridin 1 from Litoria splendida.
Literature.Author: Tyler M.J.,Wallace J.C.,Bowie J.H.,Waugh R.J.,Stone D.J.M.
